intro: Barbarea anfractuosa, commonly known as the wrinkled rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of wrinkled, lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
